contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "they bowed their heads in awe" or 2) "they bowed down low in reverence." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
This symbolic gesture accompanies prayer. AT: "lift up my hands and pray to Yahweh" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: spread my hands out to Yahweh

contextId.information: This symbolic gesture accompanies prayer. AT: "lifted up his hands toward Yahweh and prayed" (UDB) See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:09:29|9:29]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: spread out his hands to Yahweh

contextId.information: These symbolic acts were the normal way that people showed great respect and devotion in that culture. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
